intro: Calathea zebrina var. humilior, commonly known as the zebrina calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that feature bold, zebra-like patterns in shades of green, white, and silver. The plant belongs to the Marantaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its aesthetic appeal. Calathea zebrina var. humilior requires consistent moisture and humidity to maintain its vibrant leaf colors and overall health.
